title: Continuance of Certain Federal Advisory Committees
summary: Executive Order 14354, issued on September 29, 2025, continues various federal advisory committees until September 30, 2027. The order lists 25 committees, each associated with a specific department or agency, covering areas such as the preservation of the White House, national security, health, veterans' affairs, environmental protection, and education. The order also specifies that the heads of the respective departments or agencies will perform the President's functions under the Federal Advisory Committee Act for these committees. It supersedes sections of Executive Order 14109 and is effective from September 30, 2025. The order emphasizes compliance with applicable laws and the availability of appropriations, and clarifies that it does not create any enforceable rights or benefits.
